item.title: can_dashboard_details.txt
item.description:
I built a Qt-based CAN Dashboard for Olin’s Formula SAE Team with a heavy focus on usability, maintainability, and expandability.

Features

… (rest of your content) I built a Qt-based CAN Dashboard for Olin’s Formula SAE Team with a heavy focus on usability, maintainability, and expandability.

Features

The dashboard allows engineers to quickly and easily get live CAN information to debug our vehicle systems. It is extremely flexible, and can be used at any level, from just monitoring the messages from a single board to those from a particular enclosure or module to the entire car all at once.

item.title: About
item.description:
Hi there! I'm Jacob Likins, an electrical and computer engineering student at Olin College, passionate about building impactful technology through hands-on engineering and collaborative innovation.

I'm the Electrical Lead for our Formula SAE EV team, Olin Electric Motorsports, where I lead the development of critical vehicle systems like battery management, throttle control, and high-voltage power electronics.

I also conducted robotic simulation research at Clemson University, modeling autonomous systems and exploring intelligent control in complex environments.
